intro: Gambelia juncea, commonly known as the desert sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, gray-green leaves and showy, pink or violet flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Gambelia juncea is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
